headline: Broadcom earnings, jobless claims, mortgage rates: What to Watch
summary: Asking for a Trend host Josh Lipton previews several of the biggest stories to come tomorrow, Thursday, December 11, including earnings results reported from companies like Broadcom (AVGO), Costco (COST), and Lululemon Athletica (LULU); initial jobless claims data; and the latest reading on US mortgage rates. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend.

headline: lululemon athletica inc. Announces CEO Succession Plan
summary: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, December 11, 2025--lululemon athletica inc. (NASDAQ:LULU) today announced that Calvin McDonald plans to step down as Chief Executive Officer and member of the company’s Board of Directors, effective January 31, 2026. Mr. McDonald and the Board are working together to facilitate a smooth transition, and he will serve as a senior advisor to the company through March 31, 2026. headline: Lululemon CEO McDonald Is Stepping Down
summary: Lululemon Athletica Inc. said Chief Executive Officer Calvin McDonald is stepping down as the pricey yoga-wear brand looks to reignite growth amid pressure from upstart competition and it founder. Chief Financial Officer Meghan Frank and Chief Commercial Officer André Maestrini will serve as interim co-CEOs. BTIG Analyst Janine Stichter joins "Bloomberg The Close."

Chief Financial Officer Meghan Frank and Chief Commercial Officer André Maestrini will serve as interim co-CEOs. BTIG Analyst Janine Stichter joins "Bloomberg The Close."

headline: Lululemon Athletica CEO to step down
summary: Lululemon Athletica said on Thursday that its CEO, Calvin McDonald, will step down in January, after about seven years at the helm as the yogawear maker navigates a challenging consumer environment in the United States as well as growing competition from newer brands.

content.title: Lululemon Athletica CEO to step down
content.summary: Lululemon Athletica said on Thursday that its CEO, Calvin McDonald, will step down in January, after about seven years at the helm as the yogawear maker navigates a challenging consumer environment in the United States as well as growing competition from newer brands.

thumbnail.caption: Calvin McDonald, CEO of Lululemon Athletica inc., is interviewed by CNBC on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange in New York City on March 29, 2023. - Brendan McDermid/Reuters

headline: Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) Surprises With Q3 CY2025 Sales, Stock Jumps 10%
summary: Athletic apparel retailer Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) announced better-than-expected revenue in Q3 CY2025, with sales up 7.1% year on year to $2.57 billion. On the other hand, next quarter’s revenue guidance of $3.54 billion was less impressive, coming in 0.7% below analysts’ estimates. Its GAAP profit of $2.59 per share was 17.1% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) Surprises With Q3 CY2025 Sales, Stock Jumps 10%
content.summary: Athletic apparel retailer Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) announced better-than-expected revenue in Q3 CY2025, with sales up 7.1% year on year to $2.57 billion. On the other hand, next quarter’s revenue guidance of $3.54 billion was less impressive, coming in 0.7% below analysts’ estimates. Its GAAP profit of $2.59 per share was 17.1% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Lululemon Stock Pops on Earnings Beat and CEO Change
summary: Lululemon  Athletica stock jumped Thursday after the company posted a better-than-expected fiscal third quarter and said CEO Calvin McDonald would be stepping down next year.  “Lululemon has a strong foundation in place, and, as we look to the future, the Board is focused on identifying a leader with a track record of driving companies through periods of growth and transformation to guide the company’s next chapter of success,” said Marti Morfitt, executive chair of the board.  The CEO change comes as Lululemon continues to struggle with building up demand in the Americas, the company’s largest market.

content.title: Lululemon Stock Pops on Earnings Beat and CEO Change
content.summary: Lululemon  Athletica stock jumped Thursday after the company posted a better-than-expected fiscal third quarter and said CEO Calvin McDonald would be stepping down next year.  “Lululemon has a strong foundation in place, and, as we look to the future, the Board is focused on identifying a leader with a track record of driving companies through periods of growth and transformation to guide the company’s next chapter of success,” said Marti Morfitt, executive chair of the board.  The CEO change comes as Lululemon continues to struggle with building up demand in the Americas, the company’s largest market.

headline: Lululemon CEO Calvin McDonald to step down amid languishing sales in the US
summary: Lululemon Athletica Inc, said Thursday that its CEO Calvin McDonald is stepping down effective Jan. 31 as the athletic wear maker wrestles with a year of disappointing sales.  The company, based in Vancouver, Canada, said that McDonald and the board are working together to manage a “smooth transition,” and he will serve as a senior advisor to the company through March 31, 2026.  The board said it was conducting a comprehensive search in partnership with a leading executive search firm to select his successor.

content.title: Lululemon CEO Calvin McDonald to step down amid languishing sales in the US
content.summary: Lululemon Athletica Inc, said Thursday that its CEO Calvin McDonald is stepping down effective Jan. 31 as the athletic wear maker wrestles with a year of disappointing sales.  The company, based in Vancouver, Canada, said that McDonald and the board are working together to manage a “smooth transition,” and he will serve as a senior advisor to the company through March 31, 2026.  The board said it was conducting a comprehensive search in partnership with a leading executive search firm to select his successor.
